meanings.definition: To book more reservations than there are available seats or rooms.
meanings.sent1: The airline decided to overbook the flight to ensure all seats were filled.
meanings.sent2: Travelers were upset when they found out about the overbooking of the hotel.
meanings.sent3: The overbooking of the restaurant led to a comical situation where everyone had to share tables.
meanings.sent4: Her schedule was so overbooked that she felt like she was always rushing from one place to another.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overbooking can result in chaos and frustration for both customers and businesses.

meanings.definition: The act of booking more reservations than there are available seats or rooms.
meanings.sent1: The hotel manager had to deal with the consequences of overbooking during the holiday season.
meanings.sent2: Overbooking can sometimes lead to conflicts between customers and businesses.
meanings.sent3: The overbooking of the event venue caused a humorous mix-up in seating arrangements.
meanings.sent4: The concept of overbooking is like trying to fit a gallon of water into a pint-sized container.
meanings.sent5: The hotel's overbooking policy resulted in a full house but also some disappointed guests.
